page.title: 10COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Almost every house has a television and radio and the use of a telephone. The Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries has an information service recorded for farmers. By ringing the right Ipswich number he can get detailed advice on the next moves he should be making, whether it be drilling, or fertislising or whatever. One cannot tell how many farmers use it, but it is very detailed. The area has one postal delivery per day ad 2 collections of post from Theberton. East Green is near enough to Kelsale to use the post office there which has the same number of collections.
